Title: Human error in industrial maintenance: A systematic literature review
Authors: V. Pasquale, Chiara Franciosi, R. Iannone, Ilaria Malfettone, S. Miranda
Abstract summary: This paper reviews the literature on human error in industrial maintenance, highlighting the importance of considering human factors and the need for more research in the manufacturing sector.

Title: Human error in maintenance: An investigative study for the factories of the future
Abstract summary: This paper investigates human error in maintenance, including causes, types, and design guidelines to reduce errors, but does not specifically address distributed energy resource maintenance.

Title: Human error in maintenance: a review
Abstract summary: Human error is a significant problem in maintenance operations across industries.

Title: The Survey And Perspective Of Human Factors Associated With Maintenance Activity
Authors: Dari Alharran, Dr. Norafneeza Norazahar, Arshad Ahmad, N. Bakhary, Nur Hazirah Noh@Seth
Venue: Journal of Energy and Safety Technology (JEST)
Abstract summary: The paper identifies human factors associated with maintenance activities that can contribute to human error in aging oil and gas plants.

Title: Human Error in Power Plant Maintenance
Abstract summary: Human error is an important factor in the occurrence of safety-related incidents in power plant maintenance.

Title: Estimating and ranking the impact of human error roots on power grid maintenance group based on a combination of mathematical expectation, Shannon entropy, and TOPSIS
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a method to identify and prioritize the root causes of human error in power grid maintenance operations.

Title: ANALISIS HUMAN RELIABILITY PADA OPERATOR BAGIAN MAINTENANCE MESIN 2 DENGAN METODE HUMAN ERROR ASSESSMENT AND REDUCTION TECHNIQUE DI PT. PJB UP PAITON TAHUN 2013
Abstract summary: The paper analyzes human reliability and error in maintenance operations of distributed energy resource systems.

Title: Towards Efficient Operation and Maintenance of Wind Farms: Leveraging AI for Minimizing Human Error
Authors: A. Keprate, Stine Kilskar, Pete Andrews
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a framework to minimize human error in wind farm maintenance operations using computer vision-based recommendations.
